name: pacemaker or AICD device
description: An implantable electronic device that can help regulate the heartbeat, either by sending electrical impulses to the heart to maintain a regular beat, or by monitoring the heart's activity and delivering a shock to restore a normal rhythm if necessary

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The specific type of device

values.name: pacemaker
values.description: An electronic device that helps regulate the heart's rhythm

values.name: AICD
values.description: Automated Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator, a device that monitors heart activity and delivers a shock if necessary

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: The location of the device

values.name: left chest wall
values.description: The device is located in the left chest wall

values.name: right chest wall
values.description: The device is located in the right chest wall

attributes.name: chambers
attributes.description: The number of heart chambers the device interacts with

values.name: dual chamber
values.description: The device interacts with both the atrium and the ventricle

values.name: single chamber
values.description: The device interacts with either the atrium or the ventricle

attributes.name: lead position
attributes.description: The location where the leads from the device are positioned

values.name: right atrium
values.description: The leads from the device are positioned in the right atrium

values.name: right ventricle
values.description: The leads from the device are positioned in the right ventricle

values.name: right atrium and right ventricle
values.description: The leads from the device are positioned in the right atrium and right ventricle

values.name: right atrium, right ventricle, and coronary sinus
values.description: The leads from the device are positioned in the right atrium, right ventricle, and coronary sinus

examples.report_text: Devices/Tubes/Lines: There is a dual-chamber pacemaker device in the left chest wall, its leads are in the right atrium and right ventricle.

Devices/Tubes/Lines: Left pectoral pulse generator, with pacemaker lead in the right atrial appendage, and ICD leads in the right ventricle.   Lungs: Peripheral areas of mild bronchial wall thickening.
COMPARISON: CT chest, abdomen/pelvis -----   FINDINGS:   CHEST:  Lines, Tubes and Devices: Left chest pacemaker with right atrial and right ventricular leads.

name: healed or chronic rib fracture
description: A previously fractured rib that has healed or is in a chronic state

attributes.name: multiplicity
attributes.description: The number of rib fractures

values.name: single
values.description: A single rib fracture

values.name: multiple
values.description: Multiple rib fractures

attributes.name: side
attributes.description: The side of the body where the rib fracture is located

values.name: bilateral
values.description: Fractures on both sides of the rib cage

values.name: left
values.description: Fractures of the left-sided ribs

values.name: right
values.description: Fractures of the right-sided ribs

attributes.name: level
attributes.description: The level of the rib fracture, in general or a specific rib

values.description: First rib
Second rib
Third rib
Fourth rib
Fifth rib
Sixth rib
Seventh rib
Eighth rib
Ninth rib
Tenth rib
Eleventh rib
Twelfth rib

values.name: upper
values.description: Upper ribs

values.name: lower
values.description: Lower ribs

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: The specific location of the rib fracture

values.name: anterior
values.description: Fracture is located on the front of the rib cage

values.name: posterior
values.description: Fracture is located on the back of the rib cage

values.name: lateral
values.description: Fracture is located on the side of the rib cage

values.name: anterolateral
values.description: Fracture is located on the front and side of the rib cage

values.name: posterolateral
values.description: Fracture is located on the back and side of the rib cage

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: The current state of the rib fracture

values.name: healed
values.description: Fracture has completely healed

values.name: subacute
values.description: Fracture is in a subacute state, recent but not acute, including healing fractures

values.name: chronic
values.description: Fracture is old; synonym: remote

examples.report_text: Bones: There is a stable healing fracture of the posterior RIGHT 11th rib. Status-post resection of 7-9th right ribs with mesh reconstruction. No suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.
Bones: There is a healed rib fracture in the right posterior 10th rib. No other acute fracture or dislocation. No suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.
Healed anterior right sixth rib fracture and anterolateral left fifth rib fracture are observed with no acute rib fractures.
Healing fracture of the RIGHT seventh rib is observed with mild degenerative changes within the thoracic spine.
Multiple remote healed right rib fractures are visible with no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.
Old, healed fracture involving the proximal sternal body and a few subacute/chronic left-sided rib fractures are observed.
height loss. Old healed right lower rib fractures. No new osseous destructive lesion.
Healed rib fracture in the left posterior 10th rib is observed with mild osteopenia and degenerative changes of the thoracic spine.

name: post-radiation pulmonary changes
description: Changes to the lungs following radiation treatment, including fibrosis, consolidation, or other structural modifications

values.name: right lung

values.name: left lung

values.name: left lower lung
values.description: Changes in the lower part of the left lung

values.name: right lower lung
values.description: Changes in the lower part of the right lung

values.description: Changes in the perihilar or perimediastinal region of the right lung

attributes.description: The status of the post-radiation changes over time

values.name: stable
values.description: Changes are stable and have not significantly changed over time; also called unchanged

values.name: decreased

values.name: evolving
values.description: Changes are evolving and show signs of progression

values.name: consolidative

values.name: atelectasis
values.description: Presence of atelectasis

name: post-operative changes in the lung

values.name: lobectomy
values.description: Removal of a lobe of the lung

values.name: wedge resection
values.description: Removal of a small wedge-shaped portion of the lung

values.name: segmentectomy
values.description: Removal of a segment of the lung

values.description: Removal of the pleura, the membrane that lines the lungs

values.name: transplant

examples.report_text: Stable postoperative changes in the right lung post lobectomy. No new pulmonary nodules observed.
Stable postoperative changes in the right lung post lobectomy. No new pulmonary nodules observed.
2.  Stable postsurgical changes in the left lung.
Postsurgical changes of right superior segment extremity. Unchanged right perihilar radiation fibrosis.
Postsurgical changes from right upper lobectomy, right lower lobe superior segmentectomy and left lower lobe wedge resection. Unchanged consolidative opacity in left lung apex.
Distinct post-surgical changes in the left lung. Airways remain clear.

Lungs: Postsurgical changes of left lower lobectomy. Unchanged mild peripheral scarring in the left lung. Redemonstrated diffuse mild bronchiectasis. Compensatory expansion of the right lung, as before. Patent central airways.
Stable postoperative changes in right lung base. No signs of pulmonary consolidation.
Postsurgical changes in the right lung following upper and middle lobectomy. No new pulmonary nodules.

name: mitral or aortic valve calcification
description: The accumulation of calcium salts in the mitral or aortic valve of the heart, which can cause the valve to harden and disrupt the blood flow through the heart.

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: The specific valve where the calcification is located

values.name: aortic valve
values.description: Calcification is located in the aortic valve

values.name: mitral valve
values.description: Calcification is located in the mitral valve

values.name: aortic and mitral valves
values.description: Calcification is located in both the aortic and mitral valves

attributes.name: severity
attributes.description: The severity or extent of the calcification

values.name: mild
values.description: The calcification is mild

values.name: moderate
values.description: The calcification is moderate

values.name: severe
values.description: The calcification is severe or heavy

attributes.name: associated conditions
attributes.description: The conditions that are associated with the calcification

values.name: aortic stenosis

name: pericardial calcifications
description: A condition characterized by abnormal deposits of calcium in the pericardium, the sac-like structure around the heart. Usually a result of injury to the heart or pericardium and can lead to constrictive pericarditis.

attributes.name: presence
attributes.description: Presence of pericardial calcifications

values.name: present
values.description: Pericardial calcifications present

values.name: absent
values.description: Pericardial calcifications absent

examples.report_text: Pericardial calcifications noted along with moderate amount of coronary calcifications. Small pericardial effusion present.

left atrial enlargement. No significant pericardial effusion. Severe amount of coronary calcifications. Aortic valvular calcifications. Punctate calcifications associated with the papillary muscles. Small hiatal hernia. Calcified atheromatous
Mediastinum: Heart size and pericardium are normal. Moderate amount of coronary calcifications. Moderate thoracic and abdominal aortic calcification. No thyroid nodules.
Heart and pericardium are within normal limits with pericardial calcifications. No pericardial effusion. Mild coronary artery calcifications.

examples.report_text: Compression deformity of T7 in thoracic spine, similar to prior.
Bones: There is stable compression of multiple thoracic vertebral bodies. Post kyphoplasty changes are noted at L1

Bones: Osteopenia. Accentuated thoracic kyphosis. Status post median sternotomy. Skeletal degenerative changes with multiple similar appearing wedge-shaped compression deformities. Unchanged L2 vertebral body compression deformity harboring a
THORACIC AND LUMBAR SPINE: Alignment and Curvature: No traumatic malalignment. Stable anterolisthesis of L4 on L5   Vertebrae: New compression deformity of the T9 vertebral body.
thoracic and upper lumbar spine. Multilevel osteoporotic compression deformities of the thoracic spine, most severe at T4 with approximately 70% loss of height.

Vertebrae: Compression deformities involving T3, T4, T5, T7, T8, L1, L3 and L5vertebral bodies. The compression deformities in the lumbar spine are chronic. The compression deformities in the thoracic spine are age-indeterminate, likely chronic.

name: traction bronchiectasis
description: A respiratory disorder characterized by an abnormal, irreversible dilation of the bronchi, often associated with chronic inflammation or infection. In the case of 'traction bronchiectasis', the dilation is caused by fibrosis pulling the bronchial walls apart.

values.description: Both lungs

values.name: consolidation
values.description: Area of the lung tissue filled with liquid instead of air

name: fibrotic changes or honeycombing
description: A pattern of lung disease characterized by irreversible fibrosis, leading to a honeycomb appearance due to thickened interlobular septa and intralobular lines

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: The anatomical region of the fibrotic changes or honeycombing

values.name: biteral lower
values.description: Lower parts of the lungs; also called basilar or bibasilar or the lung bases

values.name: bilateral upper zone
values.description: Upper parts of the lungs

values.name: bilateral
values.description: Throughout both lungs

values.name: right lung
values.description: Right lung

values.name: left lung
values.description: Left lung

attributes.name: change
attributes.description: The progression of the fibrotic changes or honeycombing over time

values.name: progression
values.description: Increase or worsening of fibrotic changes or honeycombing

values.name: stable
values.description: No significant change in fibrotic changes or honeycombing

values.name: unchanged
values.description: No change in fibrotic changes or honeycombing

attributes.name: honeycombing
attributes.description: Whether or not honeycombing is present

values.name: present
values.description: Honeycombing is present

values.name: absent
values.description: Honeycombing is not present

attributes.name: associated features
attributes.description: Other radiological findings associated with the fibrotic changes or honeycombing

values.name: groundglass opacities
values.description: Areas of increased attenuation in the lung with preserved bronchial and vascular markings

values.name: consolidation
values.description: An area of the lung parenchyma that has filled with liquid instead of air

values.name: traction bronchiectasis
values.description: Irreversible widening of the bronchi or bronchioles caused by destruction of the muscle and elastic tissue

values.name: reticulations
values.description: A network of lines in the lung

values.name: interlobular and intralobular septal thickening
values.description: Thickening of the walls that separate the lobules of the lungs

name: emphysematous change
description: A pathological change in the lung tissue caused by emphysema, characterized by the enlargement of air spaces distal to the terminal bronchioles and destruction of alveolar walls

attributes.description: The extent or seriousness of the emphysematous change

values.name: mild
values.description: Small in extent or seriousness

values.name: moderate
values.description: Neither mild nor severe

values.name: severe
values.description: Of a great or serious extent or degree

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The specific pattern of emphysematous change

values.name: centrilobular
values.description: Involving the central part of the lobule, typically associated with smoking

values.name: paraseptal
values.description: Involving the outer parts of the lobule, near the pleura

values.name: panlobular
values.description: Involving the entire lobule, typically seen in alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency

values.name: centrilobular and paraseptal
values.description: Combined features of centrilobular and paraseptal emphysema

values.description: The shoulder or upper arm area

values.name: pelvic
values.description: The lower abdomen area

values.name: breasts
values.description: The breast area

attributes.name: appearance
attributes.description: The visual or physical characteristics of the nodule

values.name: sebaceous cyst
values.description: A small, noncancerous bump beneath the skin, which can be filled with a yellowish, oily substance

values.name: inclusion cyst
values.description: A type of cyst that results from trauma to the skin or clogged pores

values.name: low-attenuation
values.description: Appears less dense or less absorbing on imaging

values.name: nonspecific
values.description: Not indicating a definite disease or condition

attributes.name: change
attributes.description: The change in the nodule over time

values.name: unchanged
values.description: The nodule has not changed since the last observation

values.name: stable
values.description: The nodule has remained steady or constant

values.name: increased
values.description: The nodule has grown or enlarged
